Articles.Content:
I know this has been asked before, but I can't find the thread.

Basically I want to add some realism to my KSP, the installation of RPL is overly unnecessarily complicated, when I install Realism Overhaul the game won't load so I want to install some (not all) mods from those two packs, what mods should I get? Thanks in advance,

What "level" of realism are you asking for?

If you want "realism lite", get these:

Deadly Reentry

Ferram Aerospace Research

Past that, best describe what issues you're having following the ROV install process because adding more "realism" to KSP takes work.

I'm trying to download mods from RPL thread, but number 4 mod in essentialls list says Realism Overhaul tweak/resize pack, I go to Realism Overhaul page (I clicked the link next to #4 essential mod in RPL thread) and I can't find that tweak/resize pack, I don't know what that is, or is it even necessary, so I'm downloading all mods in RPL thread except that tweak/resize pack.

EDIT: Also, I'm installing mods with KSP Mod Admin, so if anything goes wrong, if some mods don't work or something I can just disable all mods and go back to vanilla KSP

Edited June 6, 2014 by TheJoseph98

I agree that it is reasonably unclear. To download the number 4 essential mod you need to make sure you have downloaded all the essential mods on that page, then scroll down to the first picture you see. There should be a download link directly below the picture.

From the Realism Overhaul thread:

INSTALL:

1. Install required mods, updating as necessary

2. Remove any existing RealismOverhaul or RedAV8R folder in KSP/GameData/

3. Unzip this archive to KSP/GameData.

4. Pick and install an engine configs pack (see below)

Requires:

Real Solar System

Real Fuels

Procedural Parts

Deadly Reentry

Ferram Aerospace Research by ferram4

RealChutes by stupid_chris

Engine Ignitor) by HoneyFox

ModuleRCSFX by ialdabaoth

Advanced Jet Engine by camlost

Engine Support:

Realism Overhaul requires the selection of an Engine pack. The two suggested packs (pick one) are either SFJackBauer's RealEngines pack (which gives engines the stats of real-world engines that look similar, like NovaPunch K2-X -> J-2) and my Reaching for the Stars pack, which gives engines "realistic" stats informed by real-world engines without being clones.

SFJackBauer's RealEngines pack can be downloaded from http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/...l=1#post825469

My RftS Pack can be downloaded from the fourth post here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/57833. Note you also need this ExsurgentEngineerning.dll. Replace any existing version.

How is this unclear? Because the "Download" link isn't prominent above a picture? Since when did people not read the entire OP before installing a mod, especially one that makes such drastic changes to KSP?

I agree that once you know what you are looking for it is easy to find, however the amount of information on that page is significant and on a first look through you might miss the download link, or confuse it with the download for something else.
